alert.note: Alert for Eastern Addison; Eastern Chittenden; Orange; Washington; Western Addison; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 6:26PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Essex, west central Orange, Addison, southeastern Chittenden, northwestern Windsor and southwestern Washington Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 625 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Weybridge, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Middlebury, Vergennes, Moriah, Crown Point, Cornwall, Braintree Hill, Weybridge, Salisbury, Lincoln, Monkton, Whiting, New Haven, Granville, Port Henry, Addison, Hancock, Shoreham, Ripton, Starksboro, and Waltham. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Addison; Eastern Chittenden; Orange; Washington; Western Addison; Western Windsor
